title: Anne Hathaway, more celebs send support to Greta Thunberg amid bullying: 'Stay Strong'
text:
Anne Hathaway has a message for Greta Thunberg: "Stay Strong."

The actress, who has dealt with her fair share of criticism throughout her career, penned a message of support to the Swedish climate activist after the teenager gave an emotional speech at the United Nations Monday.

Thunberg, 16, has faced backlash, including from President Donald Trump and Fox News' Laura Ingraham, who compared her to "Children of the Corn."

"Dear @gretathunberg,⁣⁣" Hathaway wrote on Instagram Tuesday, "Please know that under every bridge that has ever been built there has also been a troll that comes with it–sometimes more than one. ⁣⁣The bridge–meaning that which connects and elevates–is more important than the troll.⁣⁣"

'How dare you?' Read Greta Thunberg's emotional climate change speech to UN and world leaders

Anne Hathaway (left) sent a message of support to teen climate activist Greta Thunberg (right). More

Thunberg, who has Asperger syndrome, said on Twitter Wednesday that her critics have attacked everything: "my looks, my clothes, my behaviour and my differences."

Hathaway told the teen to "stay strong" and "keep going." She concluded, "With all my gratitude and support,⁣⁣ Annie⁣⁣."

The actress' post apparently sparked more trolling, prompting Hathaway to add:

⁣⁣"Note: We don’t bully children here. If anyone feels the need to insult Greta—or anyone—for caring about the future of the planet, please leave this space immediately and consider seeking help. Your violence is not healthy and it is not welcome."

'Disgraceful': Fox News apologizes to Greta Thunberg after guest calls her 'mentally ill'

Hathaway was not the only celebrity to offer Thunberg words of encouragement.

The likes of Leonardo DiCaprio, Chris Hemsworth, Camila Cabello, Joe Jonas, Cara Delevingne and Ellie Goulding reposted Thunberg's speech on their Instagram accounts to their combined hundreds of millions of followers.

Priyanka Chopra wrote: "How dare we fail you... and what audacity we have to not want to help you save what’s left. Thank you @gretathunberg for giving us the much needed punch in the face, for bringing your generation together and showing us that we need to know better, do more to save what is most critical. At the end of the day, we only have this one planet."

Penélope Cruz added, "Bravo!"

On Twitter, Bebe Rexha dedicated her new song "You Can't Stop The Girl" from Disney's "Maleficent: Mistress of Evil" to the teen environmental activist.

The lyrics to the empowerment song include:

"They're tryna take our voices/ They're tryna make our choices/ So we scream loud, loud, loud"; "You can't stop the girl from going/ You can't stop the world from knowing/ The truth will set you free"

Hey @GretaThunberg this song is dedicated to you: https://t.co/9pqUCoBv5p — Bebe Rexha (@BebeRexha) September 26, 2019

Mark Ruffalo, who plays renowned physicist Dr. Bruce Banner and the Hulk in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, tweeted: "Take the time to read this and spread @gretathunberg’s words. #ClimateStrike #FridaysForFuture."
description: Anne Hathaway penned a message of support to teen activist Greta Thunberg after she was bullied for her emotional speech at the United Nations Monday.
